solution_line_template: Each tree A gives her six good oranges a month {tree_a_total_oranges} x {tree_a_good_percent} = <<{tree_a_total_oranges}*{tree_a_good_percent}={good_oranges_tree_a}>>{good_oranges_tree_a}

Each tree B gives her five good oranges a month because {tree_b_total_oranges} x ({tree_b_good_fraction_numerator}/{tree_b_good_fraction_denominator}) = <<{tree_b_total_oranges}*({tree_b_good_fraction_numerator}/{tree_b_good_fraction_denominator})={good_oranges_tree_b}>>{good_oranges_tree_b}

On average, a tree gives her {average_good_oranges_per_tree} oranges a month because {tree_a_proportion}({good_oranges_tree_a}) + {tree_b_proportion}({good_oranges_tree_b}) = {average_good_oranges_per_tree}
She has ten total trees because {total_good_oranges_per_month} / {average_good_oranges_per_tree} = <<{total_good_oranges_per_month}/{average_good_oranges_per_tree}={total_trees}>>{total_trees}
